text: Chang Myon(, August 28, 1899 – June 4, 1966) was 2nd, 7th Prime Minister of South Korea, 4th Vice President of South Korea. His nickname was Unsuk (, hanja:雲石). He was a special ambassador to the Vatican 1948. In 1949, United States Ambassador to South Korea, May 1950 2nd Prime Minister of South Korea. 1956 to 1960 4th Vice President of South Korea. Seventh Prime Minister in August 1960. On 16 May 1961, he was kicked out, By Park Chung hee's coup d'état. == Life == Chang Myon was born in Incheon in 1899. He was born to a Catholic family. After graduating from high school, he studied in the United States. After returning, he worked as an educator. Dongseong High School teachers, Principal. Geseong Elementary School Principal. August 15, 1945 Independence, he moved into politics. October 1948 was sent to UN, to represent of South Korea, after, December 1948 Special Ambassador to the Vatican, Ambassador to the United States. Prime Minister of South Korea November 23, 1950 to April 23, 1952. ==Related pages== * Rhee Syngman * Kim Gu * Yun Posun * Yun Chi-ho * Jang Jun-ha * Park Chung-hee * Park Soon-Chon * Shin Ik-hee * Heo Jeong == References == * http://100.naver.com/100.nhn?docid=132789 == Other websites == * Unsyk Chang Myon Memorial site * Chang Myon:National Assembly of the Republic of Korea Category:1899 births Category:1966 deaths Category:Anti-communists Category:Korean educators Category:People from Incheon Category:People of the Korean War Category:Prime Ministers of South Korea Category:Vice presidents of South Korea
title: Chang Myun
